characters.quote: Suppress, my son, this rage of grief, and know It was not man, but heaven, that gave the blow;

characters.name: Honor And Warfare
characters.quote: Now to the bloody battle let me bend:

characters.name: Mortality And Decay
characters.quote: Me fate has sever'd from the sons of earth, The fate fore-doom'd that waited from my birth:

characters.name: Heroic Anger
characters.quote: Why should, alas, a mortal man, as I, Burn with a fury that can never die?

characters.name: Honor And Atonement
characters.quote: Each due atonement gladly I prepare; And heaven regard me as I justly swear!

characters.name: Heroic Return
characters.quote: Long lost to battle, shone in arms again.

characters.name: Sacrifice
characters.quote: Twelve Trojan captives fell. On these the rage of fire victorious preys, Involves and joins them in one common blaze.

characters.name: Pity And Mercy
characters.quote: Some pity to a suppliant's name afford, Who shared the gifts of Ceres at thy board;

characters.name: Divine Lineage
characters.quote: Of Peleus, Æacus, and Jove, am I.

characters.name: Submission And Yielding
characters.quote: I yield—Let Ilion fall; if fate decree—

characters.name: Death And Mourning
characters.quote: If in the melancholy shades below, The flames of friends and lovers cease to glow, Yet mine shall sacred last; mine, undecay'd, Burn on through death, and animate my shade.

characters.name: Disgrace And Humiliation
characters.quote: Deform'd, dishonour'd, in his native land, Given to the rage of an insulting throng, And, in his parents' sight, now dragg'd along!

characters.name: Isolation And Abandonment
characters.quote: And I abandon'd, desolate, alone!

characters.name: Honor And Respect
characters.quote: Achilles sacrifices several animals, and lastly twelve Trojan captives, at the pile; then sets fire to it.

characters.name: Ritual And Respect
characters.quote: Some ease at least those pious rites may give, And soothe my sorrows, while I bear to live.

characters.name: The Afterlife
characters.quote: When once we pass, the soul returns no more:

characters.name: Honor And Legacy
characters.quote: Meantime erect the tomb with pious hands, A common structure on the humble sands: Hereafter Greece some nobler work may raise, And late posterity record our praise!

characters.name: Skill Over Strength
characters.quote: It is not strength, but art, obtains the prize, And to be swift is less than to be wise.

characters.name: Wisdom Of Experience
characters.quote: Fear not thy rivals, though for swiftness known; Compare those rivals' judgment and thy own:

characters.name: Aging And Legacy
characters.quote: Oh! had I now that force I felt of yore, Known through Buprasium and the Pylian shore!

characters.name: Failure And Misfortune
characters.quote: Unhappy Ajax stumbles on the plain

characters.name: Celebration And Camaraderie
characters.quote: With force conjoin'd heave off the weighty prize.

characters.name: Redemption
characters.quote: Achilles, moved with compassion, grants his request, detains him one night in his tent, and the next morning sends him home with the body.

characters.name: Heroic Memory
characters.quote: What toils they shared, what martial works they wrought, What seas they measured, and what fields they fought; All pass'd before him in remembrance dear, Thought follows thought, and tear succeeds to tear.

characters.name: Rage And Destruction
characters.quote: Lo, how his rage dishonest drags along Hector's dead earth, insensible of wrong!

characters.name: Fate And Acceptance
characters.quote: Fate gives the wound, and man is born to bear.

characters.name: Mortality Vs Divinity
characters.quote: Achilles, of your own ethereal race, Springs from a goddess by a man's embrace

characters.name: Honor And Recognition
characters.quote: If equal honours by the partial skies Are doom'd both heroes, (Juno thus replies,)

characters.name: Family And Loss
characters.quote: Mindful of those, who late their pride and joy, Lie pale and breathless round the fields of Troy!

characters.name: Courage And Duty
characters.quote: Some thought there must be in a soul so brave, Some sense of duty, some desire to save.

characters.name: Divine Command
characters.quote: 'Tis heaven commands me, and you urge in vain.

characters.name: Fatherly Love
characters.quote: And teach him mercy when a father prays.

characters.name: Fear And Despair
characters.quote: The afflicted monarch shiver'd with despair; Pale grew his face, and upright stood his hair; Sunk was his heart; his colour went and came; A sudden trembling shook his aged frame:

characters.name: Respect For The Dead
characters.quote: But whole he lies, neglected in the tent: This the twelfth evening since he rested there, Untouch'd by worms, untainted by the air.

characters.name: Suppliance And Humility
characters.quote: Thus forced to kneel, thus grovelling to embrace

characters.name: Suffering And Loss
characters.quote: The best, the bravest, of my sons are slain!

characters.name: Heroism Vs. Humanity
characters.quote: They bore as heroes, but they felt as man.

characters.name: Companionship And Loyalty
characters.quote: O friend! forgive me, that I thus fulfil (Restoring Hector) heaven's unquestion'd will.

locations.name: Greek Camp
locations.quote: The Greek camp was filled with the sounds of warriors preparing for battle, their spirits high as they awaited the call to arms.

locations.name: Battlefield
locations.quote: The battlefield was a chaotic scene of clashing swords and cries of warriors, where fate would be decided.

locations.name: Achilles' Tent
locations.quote: In Achilles' tent, the great warrior brooded over his grievances, his heart heavy with anger and pride.

locations.name: Sea-shore
locations.quote: The sea-shore echoed with the crashing waves, a reminder of the distant homeland the warriors fought to protect.

locations.name: Heavenly Throne Room
locations.quote: In the heavenly throne room, the gods convened to discuss the fate of mortals, their voices echoing with divine authority.

locations.name: Agamemnon's Tent
locations.quote: Agamemnon's tent was a hub of strategy, where the king plotted the next moves against the Trojans.

locations.name: Council Of Chiefs
locations.quote: The council of chiefs gathered to debate the course of the war, their voices rising in passionate discourse.

locations.name: River Scamander
locations.quote: The River Scamander flowed fiercely, its waters stained with the blood of fallen warriors.

locations.name: Myrinne's Tomb
locations.quote: Myrinne's tomb stood solemnly, a reminder of the cost of war and the lives lost in battle.

locations.name: Troy
locations.quote: The walls of Troy loomed high, a fortress of defiance against the besieging Greek forces.

locations.name: Palace Of Paris
locations.quote: In the palace of Paris, the prince plotted his next moves, surrounded by luxury amidst the chaos of war.

locations.name: Grecian Wall
locations.quote: The Grecian wall stood as a testament to the Greeks' determination to protect their homeland from invaders.

locations.name: Two Camps
locations.quote: The two camps faced each other, a stark division between the Greeks and Trojans, each preparing for the inevitable clash.

locations.name: The Trenches
locations.quote: The trenches were filled with warriors, ready to defend their positions against the advancing enemy.

locations.name: Trojan Camp
locations.quote: The Trojan camp buzzed with activity, warriors sharpening their weapons and preparing for the next assault.

locations.name: Thracian Camp
locations.quote: The Thracian camp was a place of fierce warriors, ready to join the fray and fight for glory.

locations.name: Field Near The Monument Of Ilus
locations.quote: The field near the monument of Ilus was a sacred ground, where heroes were honored and battles fought.

locations.name: Mount Ida
locations.quote: Mount Ida rose majestically, a vantage point for the gods to watch the unfolding drama of war.

locations.name: Palace Of Vulcan
locations.quote: In the palace of Vulcan, the god of fire crafted weapons for the heroes, his forge blazing with divine energy.

locations.name: Heaven And Earth
locations.quote: In the realm of heaven and earth, the gods debated the fates of mortals, their decisions echoing through the ages.

locations.name: Funeral Pyre Of Patroclus
locations.quote: The funeral pyre of Patroclus burned brightly, a somber tribute to a fallen hero and a catalyst for revenge.

locations.name: Racing Field
locations.quote: The racing field was a place of competition, where warriors showcased their skills in honor of the gods.

locations.name: Funeral Games
locations.quote: The funeral games were held in memory of the fallen, a mix of grief and celebration of life.

locations.name: Priam's Palace
locations.quote: In Priam's palace, the king mourned his losses while strategizing for the defense of Troy.
